properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 1 at 3:29AM PST until March 2 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORIES IN EFFECT FOR THE LOS ANGELES AND
VENTURA MOUNTAINS THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY MONDAY...

.A cold storm system will affect the Los Angeles and Ventura
County Mountains this afternoon through early Monday. Snow levels
are expected to drop to as low as 2500 to 3000 feet by this
evening. This could bring hazardous driving conditions to portions
of the Interstate 5 Corridor and other mountain roads. Overall,
snowfall totals will average 1 to 4 inches. However, totals up to
6 inches are possible across the eastern San Gabriel Mountains
above 5000 feet.

* WHAT...Snow showers this afternoon through early Monday morning.
Snow levels will be around 4500 feet this afternoon, then will
lower to between 2500 and 3000 feet this evening. Total snow
accumulations of 1 to 3 inches are expected. North winds will
gust high as 35 mph tonight and early Monday.

* WHERE...Ventura County Mountains.

* WHEN...From noon today to 7 AM PST Monday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for reduced visibility at times
in snow, blowing snow, and fog. Freezing temperatures will
affect roadways including Highway 33 overnight with possible
light snow accumulations on the roadway.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions from CalTrans are available by calling
1 800 4 2 7 7 6 2 3.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 AM PST MONDAY
